streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Basic question with answer
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Simple factual question answered in the same meeting
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[10:15:30] Speaker A: "Hello everyone, thanks for joining. I wanted to discuss our Q4 infrastructure budget. Does anyone have the latest numbers?"

[10:16:05] Speaker B: "I think Sarah sent that in an email last week. Let me check."

[10:16:45] Speaker C: "The budget is $250,000 for infrastructure, including cloud costs and new servers."

[10:17:20] Speaker A: "Perfect, thank you. John, can you update the spreadsheet with those numbers by Friday?"

[10:17:35] Speaker D (John): "Sure, I'll update it by end of week."

expected_detections.text: Does anyone have the latest numbers?
expected_detections.speaker: Speaker A

expected_detections.description: Update the spreadsheet with infrastructure budget numbers

expected_detections.answer_text: The budget is $250,000 for infrastructure, including cloud costs and new servers.
expected_detections.speaker: Speaker C

streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Implicit question
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Question phrased as wondering/curious, not explicit question mark
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[14:22:10] Speaker A: "I'm wondering about our timeline for the product launch. Has that been decided yet?"

[14:22:45] Speaker B: "Good question. Marketing suggested mid-November, but we're still finalizing with engineering."

expected_detections.text: I'm wondering about our timeline for the product launch. Has that been decided yet?
expected_detections.speaker: Speaker A

streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Action with partial information
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Action mentioned without owner or deadline initially
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[09:30:15] Speaker A: "We need to review the security audit findings."

[09:30:45] Speaker B: "I can take that on. When do you need it by?"

[09:31:10] Speaker A: "Let's aim for next Wednesday, before the board meeting."

streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Multiple commitments
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Several action items discussed in quick succession
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[11:05:20] Speaker A: "Alright, for next steps: Sarah, can you draft the proposal? John will review the budget. And I'll schedule the client meeting."

[11:05:50] Speaker B (Sarah): "Sure, I'll have the draft ready by tomorrow."

[11:06:05] Speaker C (John): "I can review it by end of week."

streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Opinion question (should not detect)
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Rhetorical or opinion-seeking question that doesn't need tracking
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[13:15:30] Speaker A: "Don't you think the new design looks great?"

[13:15:45] Speaker B: "Yeah, I really like it!"

streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Clarification question
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Question seeking clarification on previous statement
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[10:45:20] Speaker A: "The deployment window is next Tuesday at 3 AM."

[10:45:35] Speaker B: "Wait, is that our time zone or UTC?"

[10:45:50] Speaker A: "Our time zone, Eastern Time."

expected_detections.text: Wait, is that our time zone or UTC?
expected_detections.speaker: Speaker B

streaming_intelligence_examples.name: Action-seeking question
streaming_intelligence_examples.description: Question that's really a request for someone to do something
streaming_intelligence_examples.transcript:
[14:10:15] Speaker A: "Can someone check if the API endpoints are still working after the update?"

[14:10:40] Speaker B: "I'll test them right now."

expected_detections.text: Can someone check if the API endpoints are still working after the update?
expected_detections.speaker: Speaker A

expected_detections.description: Test API endpoints after the update

meeting_context_search_examples.name: Answer found earlier in meeting
meeting_context_search_examples.question: What's the Q4 infrastructure budget?
meeting_context_search_examples.transcript:
[10:00:15] Speaker A: "Let's start with the budget review."

[10:02:30] Speaker B: "The Q4 infrastructure budget is $250,000, including cloud costs."

[10:05:45] Speaker C: "Noted, thanks."

[10:15:30] Speaker D: "Sorry I joined late. What's the Q4 infrastructure budget?"

expected_response.answer_text: The Q4 infrastructure budget is $250,000, including cloud costs.

quotes.text: The Q4 infrastructure budget is $250,000, including cloud costs.
quotes.speaker: Speaker B

meeting_context_search_examples.name: Answer not in transcript
meeting_context_search_examples.question: What's our customer retention rate?
meeting_context_search_examples.transcript:
[10:00:15] Speaker A: "Let's discuss the product roadmap."

[10:02:30] Speaker B: "We're planning three major features for Q4."

[10:05:45] Speaker C: "That sounds good."

meeting_context_search_examples.name: Semantic match (different wording)
meeting_context_search_examples.question: Who's responsible for the security audit?
meeting_context_search_examples.transcript:
[09:15:20] Speaker A: "We need someone to lead the security review."

[09:16:10] Speaker B: "I can handle the security audit. I'll start next week."

[09:17:05] Speaker A: "Perfect, thanks Sarah."

expected_response.answer_text: Sarah is responsible for the security audit, starting next week.

quotes.text: I can handle the security audit. I'll start next week.
quotes.speaker: Speaker B

gpt_generated_answer_examples.name: General knowledge question (high confidence)
gpt_generated_answer_examples.question: What's the typical ROI timeline for infrastructure investments?

expected_response.answer: Typical infrastructure investments show ROI within 18-36 months, depending on the scope. Cloud infrastructure often delivers faster returns (12-18 months) compared to on-premises hardware (24-36 months). However, this varies significantly based on organization size and usage patterns.
expected_response.disclaimer: This answer is AI-generated and not from your documents or meeting. Please verify accuracy.

gpt_generated_answer_examples.name: Technical best practice question
gpt_generated_answer_examples.question: What's the recommended approach for database migration in microservices?

expected_response.answer: Common approaches include: blue-green deployment for zero-downtime migrations, backward-compatible schema changes deployed before code, or using database versioning tools like Flyway or Liquibase. The specific approach depends on your architecture and risk tolerance.
expected_response.disclaimer: This answer is AI-generated and not from your documents or meeting. Please verify accuracy.

gpt_generated_answer_examples.name: Company-specific question (should decline)
gpt_generated_answer_examples.question: What's our company's revenue for last quarter?

expected_response.answer: I cannot provide company-specific financial data as this information is not available in general knowledge. Please refer to your company's financial reports or contact your finance team for accurate quarterly revenue figures.
expected_response.disclaimer: This answer is AI-generated and not from your documents or meeting. Please verify accuracy.

gpt_generated_answer_examples.name: Highly uncertain question (low confidence)
gpt_generated_answer_examples.question: What will be the market trend for our product next year?

expected_response.answer: Market predictions are highly uncertain and depend on numerous factors specific to your industry, product, and competitive landscape. I recommend consulting market research firms or conducting customer surveys for more reliable forecasts.
expected_response.disclaimer: This answer is AI-generated and not from your documents or meeting. Please verify accuracy.

edge_cases.name: Overlapping speakers
edge_cases.transcript:
[11:20:15] Speaker A: "I think we should—"

[11:20:16] Speaker B: "Wait, about the budget—"

[11:20:18] Speaker A: "Sorry, go ahead."

[11:20:20] Speaker B: "What's the budget for marketing?"
edge_cases.note: Should detect the complete question, not the interrupted attempts

edge_cases.name: Very long action description
edge_cases.transcript: [09:45:30] Speaker A: "Sarah, we need you to coordinate with the design team on the new landing page. You'll need to gather their feedback, create a prototype, test it with users, and present the results to stakeholders by end of month."
edge_cases.note: Should detect as single action with comprehensive description

edge_cases.name: Pronouns and implicit references
edge_cases.description: Action with pronoun that needs resolution
edge_cases.transcript:
[10:30:15] Speaker A: "We need to update the documentation."

[10:30:40] Speaker B: "I'll handle it."

[10:30:55] Speaker A: "Great, can you finish by Tuesday?"
edge_cases.note: Should resolve 'it' to 'update the documentation' and 'you' to Speaker B
